But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

params.name: vcard
params.description: Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard

sections.name: Dice
sections.description: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

params.name: emoji
params.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based

params.name: value
params.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for “”, “” and “” base emoji, 1-5 for “” and “” base emoji, 1-64 for “” base emoji

sections.name: PollOption
sections.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

params.name: text
params.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

params.name: voter_count
params.description: Number of users that voted for this option

sections.name: PollAnswer
sections.description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

params.name: poll_id
params.description: Unique poll identifier

params.name: voter_chat
params.description: The chat that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter is anonymous

params.name: user
params.description: The user that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter isn't anonymous

params.name: option_ids
params.description: 0-based identifiers of chosen answer options. May be empty if the vote was retracted.

sections.name: Poll
sections.description: This object contains information about a poll.

params.name: id
params.description: Unique poll identifier

params.name: question
params.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

params.name: options
params.description: List of poll options

params.name: total_voter_count
params.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

params.name: is_closed
params.description: True, if the poll is closed

params.name: is_anonymous
params.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

params.name: type
params.description: Poll type, currently can be “regular” or “quiz”

params.name: allows_multiple_answers
params.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers

params.name: correct_option_id
params.description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

params.name: explanation
params.description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

params.name: explanation_entities
params.description: Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the explanation

params.name: open_period
params.description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

params.name: close_date
params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

sections.name: Location
sections.description: This object represents a point on the map.

params.name: latitude
params.description: Latitude as defined by sender

params.name: longitude
params.description: Longitude as defined by sender

params.name: horizontal_accuracy
params.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

params.name: live_period
params.description: Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.

params.name: heading
params.description: The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

params.name: proximity_alert_radius
params.description: The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

sections.name: Venue
sections.description: This object represents a venue.

params.name: location
params.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location

params.name: title
params.description: Name of the venue

params.name: address
params.description: Address of the venue

params.name: foursquare_id
params.description: Foursquare identifier of the venue

params.name: foursquare_type
params.description: Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

params.name: google_place_id
params.description: Google Places identifier of the venue

params.name: google_place_type
params.description: Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

sections.name: WebAppData
sections.description: Describes data sent from a Web App to the bot.

params.name: data
params.description: The data. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

params.name: button_text
params.description: Text of the web_app keyboard button from which the Web App was opened. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

sections.name: ProximityAlertTriggered
sections.description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

params.name: traveler
params.description: User that triggered the alert

params.name: watcher
params.description: User that set the alert

params.name: distance
params.description: The distance between the users

sections.name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
sections.description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

params.name: message_auto_delete_time
params.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds

sections.name: ChatBoostAdded
sections.description: This object represents a service message about a user boosting a chat.

params.name: boost_count
params.description: Number of boosts added by the user

sections.name: ForumTopicCreated
sections.description: This object represents a service message about a new forum topic created in the chat.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the topic

params.name: icon_color
params.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

params.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

sections.name: ForumTopicClosed
sections.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic closed in the chat. Currently holds no information.

sections.name: ForumTopicEdited
sections.description: This object represents a service message about an edited forum topic.

params.name: name
params.description: New name of the topic, if it was edited

params.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
params.description: New identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon, if it was edited; an empty string if the icon was removed

sections.name: ForumTopicReopened
sections.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic reopened in the chat. Currently holds no information.

sections.name: GeneralForumTopicHidden
sections.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic hidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

sections.name: GeneralForumTopicUnhidden
sections.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic unhidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

sections.name: SharedUser
sections.description: This object contains information about a user that was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestUser button.

params.name: user_id
params.description: Identifier of the shared user. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so 64-bit integers or double-precision float types are safe for storing these identifiers. The bot may not have access to the user and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the user is already known to the bot by some other means.

params.name: first_name
params.description: First name of the user, if the name was requested by the bot

params.name: last_name
params.description: Last name of the user, if the name was requested by the bot

params.name: username
params.description: Username of the user, if the username was requested by the bot

params.name: photo
params.description: Available sizes of the chat photo, if the photo was requested by the bot

sections.name: UsersShared
sections.description: This object contains information about the users whose identifiers were shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestUsers button.

params.name: request_id
params.description: Identifier of the request

params.name: users
params.description: Information about users shared with the bot.

sections.name: ChatShared
sections.description: This object contains information about a chat that was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestChat button.

params.name: request_id
params.description: Identifier of the request

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Identifier of the shared chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the chat and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the chat is already known to the bot by some other means.

params.name: title
params.description: Title of the chat, if the title was requested by the bot.

params.name: username
params.description: Username of the chat, if the username was requested by the bot and available.

params.name: photo
params.description: Available sizes of the chat photo, if the photo was requested by the bot

sections.name: WriteAccessAllowed
sections.description: This object represents a service message about a user allowing a bot to write messages after adding it to the attachment menu, launching a Web App from a link, or accepting an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess.

params.name: from_request
params.description: True, if the access was granted after the user accepted an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess

params.name: web_app_name
params.description: Name of the Web App, if the access was granted when the Web App was launched from a link

params.name: from_attachment_menu
params.description: True, if the access was granted when the bot was added to the attachment or side menu

sections.name: VideoChatScheduled
sections.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat scheduled in the chat.

params.name: start_date
params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the video chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator

sections.name: VideoChatStarted
sections.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

sections.name: VideoChatEnded
sections.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat ended in the chat.

params.name: duration
params.description: Video chat duration in seconds

sections.name: VideoChatParticipantsInvited
sections.description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a video chat.

params.name: users
params.description: New members that were invited to the video chat

sections.name: GiveawayCreated
sections.description: This object represents a service message about the creation of a scheduled giveaway. Currently holds no information.

sections.name: Giveaway
sections.description: This object represents a message about a scheduled giveaway.

params.name: chats
params.description: The list of chats which the user must join to participate in the giveaway

params.name: winners_selection_date
params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway will be selected

params.name: winner_count
params.description: The number of users which are supposed to be selected as winners of the giveaway

params.name: only_new_members
params.description: True, if only users who join the chats after the giveaway started should be eligible to win

params.name: has_public_winners
params.description: True, if the list of giveaway winners will be visible to everyone

params.name: prize_description
params.description: Description of additional giveaway prize

params.name: country_codes
params.description: A list of two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes indicating the countries from which eligible users for the giveaway must come. If empty, then all users can participate in the giveaway. Users with a phone number that was bought on Fragment can always participate in giveaways.

params.name: premium_subscription_month_count
params.description: The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for

sections.name: GiveawayWinners
sections.description: This object represents a message about the completion of a giveaway with public winners.

params.name: chat
params.description: The chat that created the giveaway

params.name: giveaway_message_id
params.description: Identifier of the message with the giveaway in the chat

params.name: winners_selection_date
params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway were selected

params.name: winner_count
params.description: Total number of winners in the giveaway

params.name: winners
params.description: List of up to 100 winners of the giveaway

params.name: additional_chat_count
params.description: The number of other chats the user had to join in order to be eligible for the giveaway

params.name: premium_subscription_month_count
params.description: The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for

params.name: unclaimed_prize_count
params.description: Number of undistributed prizes

params.name: only_new_members
params.description: True, if only users who had joined the chats after the giveaway started were eligible to win

params.name: was_refunded
params.description: True, if the giveaway was canceled because the payment for it was refunded

params.name: prize_description
params.description: Description of additional giveaway prize

sections.name: GiveawayCompleted
sections.description: This object represents a service message about the completion of a giveaway without public winners.

params.name: winner_count
params.description: Number of winners in the giveaway

params.name: unclaimed_prize_count
params.description: Number of undistributed prizes

params.name: giveaway_message
params.description: Message with the giveaway that was completed, if it wasn't deleted

sections.name: LinkPreviewOptions
sections.description: Describes the options used for link preview generation.

params.name: is_disabled
params.description: True, if the link preview is disabled

params.name: url
params.description: URL to use for the link preview. If empty, then the first URL found in the message text will be used

params.name: prefer_small_media
params.description: True, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be shrunk; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview

params.name: prefer_large_media
params.description: True, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be enlarged; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview

params.name: show_above_text
params.description: True, if the link preview must be shown above the message text; otherwise, the link preview will be shown below the message text

sections.name: UserProfilePhotos
sections.description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

params.name: total_count
params.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

params.name: photos
params.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

sections.name: File
sections.description:
This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile.

The maximum file size to download is 20 MB

params.name: file_id
params.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

params.name: file_unique_id
params.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

params.name: file_size
params.description: File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

params.name: file_path
params.description: File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.

sections.name: WebAppInfo
sections.description: Describes a Web App.

params.name: url
params.description: An HTTPS URL of a Web App to be opened with additional data as specified in Initializing Web Apps

sections.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
sections.description: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples).

params.name: keyboard
params.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of KeyboardButton objects

params.name: is_persistent
params.description: Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden. Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard can be hidden and opened with a keyboard icon.

params.name: resize_keyboard
params.description: Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

params.name: one_time_keyboard
params.description: Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat - the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

params.name: input_field_placeholder
params.description: The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters

params.name: selective
params.description: Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

sections.name: KeyboardButton
sections.description: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. For simple text buttons, String can be used instead of this object to specify the button text. The optional fields web_app, request_users, request_chat, request_contact, request_location, and request_poll are mutually exclusive.

params.name: text
params.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

params.name: request_users
params.description: If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable users. Identifiers of selected users will be sent to the bot in a “users_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

params.name: request_chat
params.description: If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable chats. Tapping on a chat will send its identifier to the bot in a “chat_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

params.name: request_contact
params.description: If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

params.name: request_location
params.description: If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

params.name: request_poll
params.description: If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

params.name: web_app
params.description: If specified, the described Web App will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a “web_app_data” service message. Available in private chats only.

sections.name: KeyboardButtonRequestUsers
sections.description: This object defines the criteria used to request suitable users. Information about the selected users will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. More about requesting users »

params.name: request_id
params.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request that will be received back in the UsersShared object. Must be unique within the message

params.name: user_is_bot
params.description: Pass True to request bots, pass False to request regular users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

params.name: user_is_premium
params.description: Pass True to request premium users, pass False to request non-premium users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

params.name: max_quantity
params.description: The maximum number of users to be selected; 1-10. Defaults to 1.

params.name: request_name
params.description: Pass True to request the users' first and last name

params.name: request_username
params.description: Pass True to request the users' username

params.name: request_photo
params.description: Pass True to request the users' photo

sections.name: KeyboardButtonRequestChat
sections.description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable chat. Information about the selected chat will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. The bot will be granted requested rights in the сhat if appropriate More about requesting chats »

params.name: request_id
params.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the ChatShared object. Must be unique within the message

params.name: chat_is_channel
params.description: Pass True to request a channel chat, pass False to request a group or a supergroup chat.

params.name: chat_is_forum
params.description: Pass True to request a forum supergroup, pass False to request a non-forum chat. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

params.name: chat_has_username
params.description: Pass True to request a supergroup or a channel with a username, pass False to request a chat without a username. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

params.name: chat_is_created
params.description: Pass True to request a chat owned by the user. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

params.name: user_administrator_rights
params.description: A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the user in the chat. The rights must be a superset of bot_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

params.name: bot_administrator_rights
params.description: A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the bot in the chat. The rights must be a subset of user_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

params.name: bot_is_member
params.description: Pass True to request a chat with the bot as a member. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

params.name: request_title
params.description: Pass True to request the chat's title

params.name: request_username
params.description: Pass True to request the chat's username

params.name: request_photo
params.description: Pass True to request the chat's photo

sections.name: KeyboardButtonPollType
sections.description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

params.name: type
params.description: If quiz is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If regular is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

sections.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
sections.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup).

params.name: remove_keyboard
params.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in ReplyKeyboardMarkup)

params.name: selective
params.description: Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

sections.name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
sections.description: This object represents an inline keyboard that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

params.name: inline_keyboard
params.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of InlineKeyboardButton objects

sections.name: InlineKeyboardButton
sections.description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

params.name: text
params.description: Label text on the button

params.name: url
params.description: HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the button is pressed. Links tg://user?id=<user_id> can be used to mention a user by their identifier without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.

params.name: callback_data
params.description: Data to be sent in a callback query to the bot when button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

params.name: web_app
params.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Available only in private chats between a user and the bot.

params.name: login_url
params.description: An HTTPS URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the Telegram Login Widget.

params.name: switch_inline_query
params.description: If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. May be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted.

params.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
params.description: If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. May be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat - good for selecting something from multiple options.

params.name: switch_inline_query_chosen_chat
params.description: If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats of the specified type, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field

params.name: callback_game
params.description: Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

params.name: pay
params.description: Specify True, to send a Pay button.NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.

sections.name: LoginUrl
sections.description:
This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the Telegram Login Widget when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:

  

Telegram apps support these buttons as of version 5.7.

Sample bot: @discussbot

params.name: url
params.description: An HTTPS URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

params.name: forward_text
params.description: New text of the button in forwarded messages.

params.name: bot_username
params.description: Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

params.name: request_write_access
params.description: Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

sections.name: SwitchInlineQueryChosenChat
sections.description: This object represents an inline button that switches the current user to inline mode in a chosen chat, with an optional default inline query.

params.name: query
params.description: The default inline query to be inserted in the input field. If left empty, only the bot's username will be inserted

params.name: allow_user_chats
params.description: True, if private chats with users can be chosen

params.name: allow_bot_chats
params.description: True, if private chats with bots can be chosen

params.name: allow_group_chats
params.description: True, if group and supergroup chats can be chosen

params.name: allow_channel_chats
params.description: True, if channel chats can be chosen

sections.name: CallbackQuery
sections.description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an inline keyboard. If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in inline mode), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this query

params.name: from
params.description: Sender

params.name: message
params.description: Message sent by the bot with the callback button that originated the query

params.name: inline_message_id
params.description: Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

params.name: chat_instance
params.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in games.

params.name: data
params.description: Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that the message originated the query can contain no callback buttons with this data.

params.name: game_short_name
params.description: Short name of a Game to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

sections.name: ForceReply
sections.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode.

params.name: force_reply
params.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

params.name: input_field_placeholder
params.description: The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

params.name: selective
params.description: Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.

sections.name: ChatPhoto
sections.description: This object represents a chat photo.

params.name: small_file_id
params.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

params.name: small_file_unique_id
params.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

params.name: big_file_id
params.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

params.name: big_file_unique_id
params.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

sections.name: ChatInviteLink
sections.description: Represents an invite link for a chat.

params.name: invite_link
params.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with “…”.

params.name: creator
params.description: Creator of the link

params.name: creates_join_request
params.description: True, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators

params.name: is_primary
params.description: True, if the link is primary

params.name: is_revoked
params.description: True, if the link is revoked

params.name: name
params.description: Invite link name

params.name: expire_date
params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired

params.name: member_limit
params.description: The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

params.name: pending_join_request_count
params.description: Number of pending join requests created using this link

sections.name: ChatAdministratorRights
sections.description: Represents the rights of an administrator in a chat.

params.name: is_anonymous
params.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

params.name: can_manage_chat
params.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, get boost list, see hidden supergroup and channel members, report spam messages and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege.

params.name: can_delete_messages
params.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

params.name: can_manage_video_chats
params.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

params.name: can_restrict_members
params.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members, or access supergroup statistics

params.name: can_promote_members
params.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

params.name: can_change_info
params.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

params.name: can_invite_users
params.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

params.name: can_post_stories
params.description: True, if the administrator can post stories to the chat

params.name: can_edit_stories
params.description: True, if the administrator can edit stories posted by other users

params.name: can_delete_stories
params.description: True, if the administrator can delete stories posted by other users

params.name: can_post_messages
params.description: True, if the administrator can post messages in the channel, or access channel statistics; for channels only

params.name: can_edit_messages
params.description: True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; for channels only

params.name: can_pin_messages
params.description: True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; for groups and supergroups only

params.name: can_manage_topics
params.description: True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; for supergroups only

sections.name: ChatMemberUpdated
sections.description: This object represents changes in the status of a chat member.

params.name: chat
params.description: Chat the user belongs to

params.name: from
params.description: Performer of the action, which resulted in the change

params.name: date
params.description: Date the change was done in Unix time

params.name: old_chat_member
params.description: Previous information about the chat member

params.name: new_chat_member
params.description: New information about the chat member

params.name: invite_link
params.description: Chat invite link, which was used by the user to join the chat; for joining by invite link events only.

params.name: via_chat_folder_invite_link
params.description: True, if the user joined the chat via a chat folder invite link

sections.name: ChatMember
sections.description:
This object contains information about one member of a chat. Currently, the following 6 types of chat members are supported:
 - ChatMemberOwner
 - ChatMemberAdministrator
 - ChatMemberMember
 - ChatMemberRestricted
 - ChatMemberLeft
 - ChatMemberBanned

sections.name: ChatMemberOwner
sections.description: Represents a chat member that owns the chat and has all administrator privileges.

params.name: status
params.description: The member's status in the chat, always “creator”

params.name: user
params.description: Information about the user

params.name: is_anonymous
params.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

params.name: custom_title
params.description: Custom title for this user

sections.name: ChatMemberAdministrator
sections.description: Represents a chat member that has some additional privileges.

params.name: status
params.description: The member's status in the chat, always “administrator”

params.name: user

sections.name: BotCommand
sections.description: This object represents a bot command.

params.description: Text of the command; 1-32 characters. Can contain only lowercase English letters, digits and underscores.

params.name: description
params.description: Description of the command; 1-256 characters.

sections.name: BotCommandScope
sections.description:
This object represents the scope to which bot commands are applied. Currently, the following 7 scopes are supported:
 - BotCommandScopeDefault
 - BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
 - BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
 - BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
 - BotCommandScopeChat
 - BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
 - BotCommandScopeChatMember

sections.name: Determining list of commands
sections.description:
The following algorithm is used to determine the list of commands for a particular user viewing the bot menu. The first list of commands which is set is returned:
Commands in the chat with the bot
 - botCommandScopeChat + language_code
 - botCommandScopeChat
 - botCommandScopeAllPrivateChats + language_code
 - botCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
 - botCommandScopeDefault + language_code
 - botCommandScopeDefault
Commands in group and supergroup chats
 - botCommandScopeChatMember + language_code
 - botCommandScopeChatMember
 - botCommandScopeChatAdministrators + language_code (administrators only)
 - botCommandScopeChatAdministrators (administrators only)
 - botCommandScopeChat + language_code
 - botCommandScopeChat
 - botCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators + language_code (administrators only)
 - botCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators (administrators only)
 - botCommandScopeAllGroupChats + language_code
 - botCommandScopeAllGroupChats
 - botCommandScopeDefault + language_code
 - botCommandScopeDefault

sections.name: BotCommandScopeDefault
sections.description: Represents the default scope of bot commands. Default commands are used if no commands with a narrower scope are specified for the user.

params.name: type
params.description: Scope type, must be default

sections.name: BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
sections.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all private chats.

params.name: type
params.description: Scope type, must be all_private_chats

sections.name: BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
sections.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chats.

params.name: type
params.description: Scope type, must be all_group_chats

sections.name: BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
sections.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chat administrators.

params.name: type
params.description: Scope type, must be all_chat_administrators

sections.name: BotCommandScopeChat
sections.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific chat.

params.name: type
params.description: Scope type, must be chat

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

sections.name: BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators

params.name: type
params.description: Scope type, must be chat_administrators

params.name: chat_id

sections.name: MenuButton
sections.description:
This object describes the bot's menu button in a private chat. It should be one of
 - MenuButtonCommands
 - MenuButtonWebApp
 - MenuButtonDefault
If a menu button other than MenuButtonDefault is set for a private chat, then it is applied in the chat. Otherwise the default menu button is applied. By default, the menu button opens the list of bot commands.

sections.name: MenuButtonCommands
sections.description: Represents a menu button, which opens the bot's list of commands.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the button, must be commands

sections.name: MenuButtonWebApp
sections.description: Represents a menu button, which launches a Web App.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the button, must be web_app

params.name: text
params.description: Text on the button

params.name: web_app
params.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery.

sections.name: MenuButtonDefault
sections.description: Describes that no specific value for the menu button was set.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the button, must be default

This object describes the source of a chat boost. It can be one of

 - ChatBoostSourceGiftCode

sections.name: ChatBoostSourcePremium
sections.description: The boost was obtained by subscribing to Telegram Premium or by gifting a Telegram Premium subscription to another user.

params.name: user

sections.name: ChatBoostSourceGiftCode

params.description: Source of the boost, always “gift_code”

params.name: user
params.description: User for which the gift code was created

sections.name: ChatBoostSourceGiveaway

params.name: user
params.description: User that won the prize in the giveaway if any

params.name: is_unclaimed
params.description: True, if the giveaway was completed, but there was no user to win the prize

params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the boost will automatically expire, unless the booster's Telegram Premium subscription is prolonged

params.name: source

sections.name: BusinessConnection

params.description: Business account user that created the business connection

This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

sections.name: ResponseParameters
sections.description: Describes why a request was unsuccessful.

params.name: migrate_to_chat_id

This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

sections.name: InputMedia

This object represents the content of a media message to be sent. It should be one of

 - InputMediaDocument

sections.name: InputMediaPhoto
sections.description: Represents a photo to be sent.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be photo

params.name: media
params.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files »

params.name: caption
params.description: Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: caption_entities
params.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: has_spoiler
params.description: Pass True if the photo needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

sections.name: InputMediaVideo

More information on Sending Files »

params.name: thumbnail
params.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. params.name: disable_content_type_detection

sections.name: InputFile
sections.description: This object represents the contents of a file to be uploaded. Must be posted using multipart/form-data in the usual way that files are uploaded via the browser.

sections.name: Sending files
sections.description:
There are three ways to send files (photos, stickers, audio, media, etc.):
 - If the file is already stored somewhere on the Telegram servers, you don't need to reupload it: each file object has a file_id field, simply pass this file_id as a parameter instead of uploading. There are no limits for files sent this way.
 - Provide Telegram with an HTTP URL for the file to be sent. Telegram will download and send the file. 5 MB max size for photos and 20 MB max for other types of content.
 - Post the file using multipart/form-data in the usual way that files are uploaded via the browser. 10 MB max size for photos, 50 MB for other files.
Sending by file_id
 - It is not possible to change the file type when resending by file_id. I.e. a video can't be sent as a photo, a photo can't be sent as a document, etc.
 - It is not possible to resend thumbnails.
 - Resending a photo by file_id will send all of its sizes.
 - file_id is unique for each individual bot and can't be transferred from one bot to another.
 - file_id uniquely identifies a file, but a file can have different valid file_ids even for the same bot.
Sending by URL
 - When sending by URL the target file must have the correct MIME type (e.g., audio/mpeg for sendAudio, etc.).
 - In sendDocument, sending by URL will currently only work for GIF, PDF and ZIP files.
 - To use sendVoice, the file must have the type audio/ogg and be no more than 1MB in size. 1-20MB voice notes will be sent as files.
 - Other configurations may work but we can't guarantee that they will.

documentation.name: Available methods
documentation.description: All methods in the Bot API are case-insensitive. We support GET and POST HTTP methods. Use either URL query string or application/json or application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data for passing parameters in Bot API requests.On successful call, a JSON-object containing the result will be returned.

sections.name: getMe
sections.description: A simple method for testing your bot's authentication token. Requires no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot in form of a User object.

sections.name: logOut
sections.description: Use this method to log out from the cloud Bot API server before launching the bot locally. You must log out the bot before running it locally, otherwise there is no guarantee that the bot will receive updates. After a successful call, you can immediately log in on a local server, but will not be able to log in back to the cloud Bot API server for 10 minutes. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

sections.name: close
sections.description: Use this method to close the bot instance before moving it from one local server to another. You need to delete the webhook before calling this method to ensure that the bot isn't launched again after server restart. The method will return error 429 in the first 10 minutes after the bot is launched. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

sections.name: Formatting options
sections.description:
The Bot API supports basic formatting for messages. You can use bold, italic, underlined, strikethrough, spoiler text, block quotations as well as inline links and pre-formatted code in your bots' messages. Telegram clients will render them accordingly. You can specify text entities directly, or use markdown-style or HTML-style formatting. Note that Telegram clients will display an alert to the user before opening an inline link ('Open this link?' together with the full URL). Message entities can be nested, providing following restrictions are met:- If two entities have common characters, then one of them is fully contained inside another.- bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, and spoiler entities can contain and can be part of any other entities, except pre and code.- blockquote entities can't be nested.- All other entities can't contain each other. Links tg://user?id= can be used to mention a user by their identifier without using a username. Please note: - These links will work only if they are used inside an inline link or in an inline keyboard button. For example, they will not work, when used in a message text. - Unless the user is a member of the chat where they were mentioned, these mentions are only guaranteed to work if the user has contacted the bot in private in the past or has sent a callback query to the bot via an inline button and doesn't have Forwarded Messages privacy enabled for the bot. You can find the list of programming and markup languages for which syntax highlighting is supported at libprisma#supported-languages. MarkdownV2 style To use this mode, pass MarkdownV2 in the parse_mode field. Use the following syntax in your message: `*bold \*text* _italic \*text_ __underline__ ~strikethrough~ ||spoiler|| *bold _italic bold ~italic bold strikethrough ||italic bold strikethrough spoiler||~ __underline italic bold___ bold* [inline URL](http://www.example.com/) [inline mention of a user](tg://user?id=123456789) ![](tg://emoji?id=5368324170671202286) `inline fixed-width code` ``` pre-formatted fixed-width code block ``` ```python pre-formatted fixed-width code block written in the Python programming language ``` >Block quotation started >Block quotation continued >The last line of the block quotation** >The second block quotation started right after the previous\r >The third block quotation started right after the previous` Please note: - Any character with code between 1 and 126 inclusively can be escaped anywhere with a preceding '\' character, in which case it is treated as an ordinary character and not a part of the markup. This implies that '\' character usually must be escaped with a preceding '\' character. - Inside pre and code entities, all '`' and '\' characters must be escaped with a preceding '\' character. - Inside the (...) part of the inline link and custom emoji definition, all ')' and '\' must be escaped with a preceding '\' character. - In all other places characters '_', '*', '[', ']', '(', ')', '~', '`', '>', '#', '+', '-', '=', '|', '{', '}', '.', '!' must be escaped with the preceding character '\'. - In case of ambiguity between italic and underline entities __ is always greadily treated from left to right as beginning or end of underline entity, so instead of ___italic underline___ use ___italic underline_\r__, where \r is a character with code 13, which will be ignored. - A valid emoji must be provided as an alternative value for the custom emoji. The emoji will be shown instead of the custom emoji in places where a custom emoji cannot be displayed (e.g., system notifications) or if the message is forwarded by a non-premium user. It is recommended to use the emoji from the emoji field of the custom emoji sticker. - Custom emoji entities can only be used by bots that purchased additional usernames on Fragment. HTML style To use this mode, pass HTML in the parse_mode field. The following tags are currently supported: `bold, bold italic, italic underline, underline strikethrough, strikethrough, strikethrough spoiler, spoiler bold italic bold italic bold strikethrough italic bold strikethrough spoiler underline italic bold bold inline URL inline mention of a user inline fixed-width code 
pre-formatted fixed-width code block
pre-formatted fixed-width code block written in the Python programming language
Block quotation started\nBlock quotation continued\nThe last line of the block quotation
` Please note: - Only the tags mentioned above are currently supported. - All <, > and & symbols that are not a part of a tag or an HTML entity must be replaced with the corresponding HTML entities (< with <, > with > and & with &). - All numerical HTML entities are supported. - The API currently supports only the following named HTML entities: <, >, & and ". - Use nested pre and code tags, to define programming language for pre entity. - Programming language can't be specified for standalone code tags. - A valid emoji must be used as the content of the tg-emoji tag. The emoji will be shown instead of the custom emoji in places where a custom emoji cannot be displayed (e.g., system notifications) or if the message is forwarded by a non-premium user. It is recommended to use the emoji from the emoji field of the custom emoji sticker. - Custom emoji entities can only be used by bots that purchased additional usernames on Fragment. Markdown style This is a legacy mode, retained for backward compatibility. To use this mode, pass Markdown in the parse_mode field. Use the following syntax in your message: `*bold text* _italic text_ [inline URL](http://www.example.com/) [inline mention of a user](tg://user?id=123456789) `inline fixed-width code` ``` pre-formatted fixed-width code block ``` ```python pre-formatted fixed-width code block written in the Python programming language ```` Please note: - Entities must not be nested, use parse mode MarkdownV2 instead. - There is no way to specify “underline”, “strikethrough”, “spoiler”, “blockquote” and “custom_emoji” entities, use parse mode MarkdownV2 instead. - To escape characters '_', '*', '`', '[' outside of an entity, prepend the characters '\' before them. - Escaping inside entities is not allowed, so entity must be closed first and reopened again: use _snake_\__case_ for italic snake_case and *2*\**2=4* for bold 2*2=4.

Service messages and messages with protected content can't be forwarded. Album grouping is kept for forwarded messages. On success, an array of MessageId of the sent messages is returned.

A quiz poll can be copied only if the value of the field correct_option_id is known to the bot. The method is analogous to the method forwardMessage, but the copied message doesn't have a link to the original message. Returns the MessageId of the sent message on success.

params.description: Audio file to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files »

params.name: caption

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

params.name: protect_content

params.description: Description of the message to reply to

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove a reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a business account

sections.name: sendVideoNote
sections.description: As of v.4.0, Telegram clients support rounded square MPEG4 videos of up to 1 minute long. Use this method to send video messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.

params.name: business_connection_id

params.name: message_thread_id

params.name: video_note
params.description: Video note to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a video note that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended) or upload a new video using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files ». Sending video notes by a URL is currently unsupported

params.name: duration
params.description: Duration of sent video in seconds

params.name: length
params.description: Video width and height, i.e. diameter of the video message

params.name: thumbnail
params.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files »

sections.description: Use this method to send a native poll. On success, the sent Message is returned.

params.name: business_connection_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

params.name: question
params.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

params.name: options
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of answer options, 2-10 strings 1-100 characters each

params.name: is_anonymous
params.description: True, if the poll needs to be anonymous, defaults to True

params.name: type
params.description: Poll type, “quiz” or “regular”, defaults to “regular”

params.name: allows_multiple_answers
params.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers, ignored for polls in quiz mode, defaults to False

params.name: correct_option_id
params.description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option, required for polls in quiz mode

params.name: explanation
params.description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds after entities parsing

params.name: explanation_parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the explanation. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: explanation_entities
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll explanation, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: open_period
params.description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation, 5-600. Can't be used together with close_date.

params.name: close_date
params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed. Must be at least 5 and no more than 600 seconds in the future. Can't be used together with open_period.

params.name: is_closed
params.description: Pass True if the poll needs to be immediately closed. This can be useful for poll preview.

params.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

params.name: emoji
params.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based. Currently, must be one of “”, “”, “”, “”, “”, or “”. Dice can have values 1-6 for “”, “” and “”, values 1-5 for “” and “”, and values 1-64 for “”. Defaults to “”

params.name: disable_notification
params.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

sections.name: sendChatAction
sections.description:
Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status). Returns True on success.

Example: The ImageBot needs some time to process a request and upload the image. Instead of sending a text message along the lines of “Retrieving image, please wait…”, the bot may use sendChatAction with action = upload_photo. The user will see a “sending photo” status for the bot.

We only recommend using this method when a response from the bot will take a noticeable amount of time to arrive.

params.name: business_connection_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the action will be sent

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread; for supergroups only

params.name: action
params.description: Type of action to broadcast. Choose one, depending on what the user is about to receive: typing for text messages, upload_photo for photos, record_video or upload_video for videos, record_voice or upload_voice for voice notes, upload_document for general files, choose_sticker for stickers, find_location for location data, record_video_note or upload_video_note for video notes.

sections.name: setMessageReaction
sections.description: Use this method to change the chosen reactions on a message. Service messages can't be reacted to. Automatically forwarded messages from a channel to its discussion group have the same available reactions as messages in the channel. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Identifier of the target message. If the message belongs to a media group, the reaction is set to the first non-deleted message in the group instead.

params.name: reaction
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of reaction types to set on the message. Currently, as non-premium users, bots can set up to one reaction per message. A custom emoji reaction can be used if it is either already present on the message or explicitly allowed by chat administrators.

params.name: is_big
params.description: Pass True to set the reaction with a big animation

sections.name: getUserProfilePhotos
sections.description: Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user. Returns a UserProfilePhotos object.

params.name: user_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target user

params.name: offset
params.description: Sequential number of the first photo to be returned. By default, all photos are returned.

params.name: limit
params.description: Limits the number of photos to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

sections.name: getFile
sections.description: Use this method to get basic information about a file and prepare it for downloading. For the moment, bots can download files of up to 20MB in size. On success, a File object is returned. The file can then be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>, where <file_path> is taken from the response. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile again.

params.name: file_id
params.description: File identifier to get information about

sections.name: banChatMember
sections.description: Use this method to ban a user in a group, a supergroup or a channel. In the case of supergroups and channels, the user will not be able to return to the chat on their own using invite links, etc., unless unbanned first. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: user_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target user

params.name: until_date
params.description: Date when the user will be unbanned; Unix time. If user is banned for more than 366 days or less than 30 seconds from the current time they are considered to be banned forever. Applied for supergroups and channels only.

params.name: revoke_messages
params.description: Pass True to delete all messages from the chat for the user that is being removed. If False, the user will be able to see messages in the group that were sent before the user was removed. Always True for supergroups and channels.

sections.name: unbanChatMember
sections.description: Use this method to unban a previously banned user in a supergroup or channel. The user will not return to the group or channel automatically, but will be able to join via link, etc. The bot must be an administrator for this to work. By default, this method guarantees that after the call the user is not a member of the chat, but will be able to join it. So if the user is a member of the chat they will also be removed from the chat. If you don't want this, use the parameter only_if_banned. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: user_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target user

params.name: only_if_banned
params.description: Do nothing if the user is not banned

sections.name: restrictChatMember
sections.description: Use this method to restrict a user in a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the supergroup for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Pass True for all permissions to lift restrictions from a user. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: user_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target user

params.name: permissions
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for new user permissions

params.name: use_independent_chat_permissions
params.description: Pass True if chat permissions are set independently. Otherwise, the can_send_other_messages and can_add_web_page_previews permissions will imply the can_send_messages, can_send_audios, can_send_documents, can_send_photos, can_send_videos, can_send_video_notes, and can_send_voice_notes permissions; the can_send_polls permission will imply the can_send_messages permission.

params.name: until_date
params.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for the user; Unix time. If user is restricted for more than 366 days or less than 30 seconds from the current time, they are considered to be restricted forever

sections.name: promoteChatMember
sections.description: Use this method to promote or demote a user in a supergroup or a channel. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Pass False for all boolean parameters to demote a user. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: user_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target user

params.name: is_anonymous
params.description: Pass True if the administrator's presence in the chat is hidden

params.name: can_manage_chat
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can access the chat event log, get boost list, see hidden supergroup and channel members, report spam messages and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege.

params.name: can_delete_messages
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can delete messages of other users

params.name: can_manage_video_chats
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can manage video chats

params.name: can_restrict_members
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members, or access supergroup statistics

params.name: can_promote_members
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by him)

params.name: can_change_info
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can change chat title, photo and other settings

params.name: can_invite_users
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can invite new users to the chat

params.name: can_post_stories
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can post stories to the chat

params.name: can_edit_stories
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can edit stories posted by other users

params.name: can_delete_stories
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can delete stories posted by other users

params.name: can_post_messages
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can post messages in the channel, or access channel statistics; for channels only

params.name: can_edit_messages
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; for channels only

params.name: can_pin_messages
params.description: Pass True if the administrator can pin messages; for supergroups only

params.name: can_manage_topics
params.description: Pass True if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; for supergroups only

sections.name: setChatAdministratorCustomTitle
sections.description: Use this method to set a custom title for an administrator in a supergroup promoted by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: user_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target user

params.name: custom_title
params.description: New custom title for the administrator; 0-16 characters, emoji are not allowed

sections.name: banChatSenderChat
sections.description: Use this method to ban a channel chat in a supergroup or a channel. Until the chat is unbanned, the owner of the banned chat won't be able to send messages on behalf of any of their channels. The bot must be an administrator in the supergroup or channel for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: sender_chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target sender chat

sections.name: unbanChatSenderChat
sections.description: Use this method to unban a previously banned channel chat in a supergroup or channel. The bot must be an administrator for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: sender_chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target sender chat

sections.name: setChatPermissions
sections.description: Use this method to set default chat permissions for all members. The bot must be an administrator in the group or a supergroup for this to work and must have the can_restrict_members administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: permissions
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for new default chat permissions

params.name: use_independent_chat_permissions
params.description: Pass True if chat permissions are set independently. Otherwise, the can_send_other_messages and can_add_web_page_previews permissions will imply the can_send_messages, can_send_audios, can_send_documents, can_send_photos, can_send_videos, can_send_video_notes, and can_send_voice_notes permissions; the can_send_polls permission will imply the can_send_messages permission.

sections.name: exportChatInviteLink
sections.description: Use this method to generate a new primary invite link for a chat; any previously generated primary link is revoked. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns the new invite link as String on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

sections.name: createChatInviteLink
sections.description: Use this method to create an additional invite link for a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. The link can be revoked using the method revokeChatInviteLink. Returns the new invite link as ChatInviteLink object.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: name
params.description: Invite link name; 0-32 characters

params.name: expire_date
params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire

params.name: member_limit
params.description: The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

params.name: creates_join_request
params.description: True, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators. If True, member_limit can't be specified

sections.name: editChatInviteLink
sections.description: Use this method to edit a non-primary invite link created by the bot. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns the edited invite link as a ChatInviteLink object.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: invite_link
params.description: The invite link to edit

params.name: name
params.description: Invite link name; 0-32 characters

params.name: expire_date
params.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire

params.name: member_limit
params.description: The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

params.name: creates_join_request
params.description: True, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators. If True, member_limit can't be specified

sections.name: revokeChatInviteLink
sections.description: Use this method to revoke an invite link created by the bot. If the primary link is revoked, a new link is automatically generated. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns the revoked invite link as ChatInviteLink object.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: invite_link
params.description: The invite link to revoke

sections.name: approveChatJoinRequest

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: user_id

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

sections.name: deleteChatPhoto
