params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

sections.name: setChatTitle
sections.description: Use this method to change the title of a chat. Titles can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: title
params.description: New chat title, 1-128 characters

sections.name: setChatDescription
sections.description: Use this method to change the description of a group, a supergroup or a channel. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: description
params.description: New chat description, 0-255 characters

sections.name: pinChatMessage
sections.description: Use this method to add a message to the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' administrator right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' administrator right in a channel. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Identifier of a message to pin

params.name: disable_notification
params.description: Pass True if it is not necessary to send a notification to all chat members about the new pinned message. Notifications are always disabled in channels and private chats.

sections.name: unpinChatMessage
sections.description: Use this method to remove a message from the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' administrator right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' administrator right in a channel. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Identifier of a message to unpin. If not specified, the most recent pinned message (by sending date) will be unpinned.

sections.name: unpinAllChatMessages
sections.description: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' administrator right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' administrator right in a channel. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

sections.name: leaveChat
sections.description: Use this method for your bot to leave a group, supergroup or channel. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

sections.name: getChat
sections.description: Use this method to get up to date information about the chat. Returns a Chat object on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

sections.name: getChatAdministrators
sections.description: Use this method to get a list of administrators in a chat, which aren't bots. Returns an Array of ChatMember objects.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

sections.name: getChatMemberCount
sections.description: Use this method to get the number of members in a chat. Returns Int on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

sections.name: getChatMember
sections.description: Use this method to get information about a member of a chat. The method is only guaranteed to work for other users if the bot is an administrator in the chat. Returns a ChatMember object on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: user_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target user

sections.name: setChatStickerSet
sections.description: Use this method to set a new group sticker set for a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Use the field can_set_sticker_set optionally returned in getChat requests to check if the bot can use this method. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: sticker_set_name
params.description: Name of the sticker set to be set as the group sticker set

sections.name: deleteChatStickerSet
sections.description: Use this method to delete a group sticker set from a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Use the field can_set_sticker_set optionally returned in getChat requests to check if the bot can use this method. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

sections.name: getForumTopicIconStickers
sections.description: Use this method to get custom emoji stickers, which can be used as a forum topic icon by any user. Requires no parameters. Returns an Array of Sticker objects.

sections.name: createForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to create a topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_manage_topics administrator rights. Returns information about the created topic as a ForumTopic object.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: name
params.description: Topic name, 1-128 characters

params.name: icon_color
params.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format. Currently, must be one of 7322096 (0x6FB9F0), 16766590 (0xFFD67E), 13338331 (0xCB86DB), 9367192 (0x8EEE98), 16749490 (0xFF93B2), or 16478047 (0xFB6F5F)

params.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon. Use getForumTopicIconStickers to get all allowed custom emoji identifiers.

sections.name: editForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to edit name and icon of a topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have can_manage_topics administrator rights, unless it is the creator of the topic. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread of the forum topic

params.name: name
params.description: New topic name, 0-128 characters. If not specified or empty, the current name of the topic will be kept

params.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
params.description: New unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon. Use getForumTopicIconStickers to get all allowed custom emoji identifiers. Pass an empty string to remove the icon. If not specified, the current icon will be kept

sections.name: closeForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to close an open topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_manage_topics administrator rights, unless it is the creator of the topic. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread of the forum topic

sections.name: reopenForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to reopen a closed topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_manage_topics administrator rights, unless it is the creator of the topic. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread of the forum topic

sections.name: deleteForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to delete a forum topic along with all its messages in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_delete_messages administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread of the forum topic

sections.name: unpinAllForumTopicMessages
sections.description: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a forum topic. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_pin_messages administrator right in the supergroup. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread of the forum topic

sections.name: editGeneralForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to edit the name of the 'General' topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have can_manage_topics administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

params.name: name
params.description: New topic name, 1-128 characters

sections.name: closeGeneralForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to close an open 'General' topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_manage_topics administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

sections.name: reopenGeneralForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to reopen a closed 'General' topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_manage_topics administrator rights. The topic will be automatically unhidden if it was hidden. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

sections.name: hideGeneralForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to hide the 'General' topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_manage_topics administrator rights. The topic will be automatically closed if it was open. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

sections.name: unhideGeneralForumTopic
sections.description: Use this method to unhide the 'General' topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_manage_topics administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

sections.name: unpinAllGeneralForumTopicMessages
sections.description: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a General forum topic. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_pin_messages administrator right in the supergroup. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

sections.name: answerCallbackQuery
sections.description:
Use this method to send answers to callback queries sent from inline keyboards. The answer will be displayed to the user as a notification at the top of the chat screen or as an alert. On success, True is returned.

Alternatively, the user can be redirected to the specified Game URL. For this option to work, you must first create a game for your bot via @BotFather and accept the terms. Otherwise, you may use links like t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX that open your bot with a parameter.

params.name: callback_query_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

params.name: text
params.description: Text of the notification. If not specified, nothing will be shown to the user, 0-200 characters

params.name: show_alert
params.description: If True, an alert will be shown by the client instead of a notification at the top of the chat screen. Defaults to false.

params.name: url
params.description: URL that will be opened by the user's client. If you have created a Game and accepted the conditions via @BotFather, specify the URL that opens your game - note that this will only work if the query comes from a callback_game button.Otherwise, you may use links like t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX that open your bot with a parameter.

params.name: cache_time
params.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the callback query may be cached client-side. Telegram apps will support caching starting in version 3.14. Defaults to 0.

sections.name: getUserChatBoosts
sections.description: Use this method to get the list of boosts added to a chat by a user. Requires administrator rights in the chat. Returns a UserChatBoosts object.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the chat or username of the channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: user_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the target user

sections.name: getBusinessConnection
sections.description: Use this method to get information about the connection of the bot with a business account. Returns a BusinessConnection object on success.

params.name: business_connection_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

sections.name: setMyCommands
sections.description: Use this method to change the list of the bot's commands. See this manual for more details about bot commands. Returns True on success.

params.name: commands
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of bot commands to be set as the list of the bot's commands. At most 100 commands can be specified.

params.name: scope
params.description: A JSON-serialized object, describing scope of users for which the commands are relevant. Defaults to BotCommandScopeDefault.

params.name: language_code
params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, commands will be applied to all users from the given scope, for whose language there are no dedicated commands

sections.name: deleteMyCommands
sections.description: Use this method to delete the list of the bot's commands for the given scope and user language. After deletion, higher level commands will be shown to affected users. Returns True on success.

params.name: scope
params.description: A JSON-serialized object, describing scope of users for which the commands are relevant. Defaults to BotCommandScopeDefault.

params.name: language_code
params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, commands will be applied to all users from the given scope, for whose language there are no dedicated commands

sections.name: getMyCommands
sections.description: Use this method to get the current list of the bot's commands for the given scope and user language. Returns an Array of BotCommand objects. If commands aren't set, an empty list is returned.

params.name: scope
params.description: A JSON-serialized object, describing scope of users. Defaults to BotCommandScopeDefault.

params.name: language_code
params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code or an empty string

sections.name: setMyName
sections.description: Use this method to change the bot's name. Returns True on success.

params.name: name
params.description: New bot name; 0-64 characters. Pass an empty string to remove the dedicated name for the given language.

params.name: language_code
params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, the name will be shown to all users for whose language there is no dedicated name.

sections.name: getMyName
sections.description: Use this method to get the current bot name for the given user language. Returns BotName on success.

params.name: language_code
params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code or an empty string

sections.name: setMyDescription
sections.description: Use this method to change the bot's description, which is shown in the chat with the bot if the chat is empty. Returns True on success.

params.name: description
params.description: New bot description; 0-512 characters. Pass an empty string to remove the dedicated description for the given language.

params.name: language_code
params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, the description will be applied to all users for whose language there is no dedicated description.

sections.name: getMyDescription
sections.description: Use this method to get the current bot description for the given user language. Returns BotDescription on success.

params.name: language_code
params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code or an empty string

sections.name: setMyShortDescription
sections.description: Use this method to change the bot's short description, which is shown on the bot's profile page and is sent together with the link when users share the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: short_description
params.description: New short description for the bot; 0-120 characters. Pass an empty string to remove the dedicated short description for the given language.

params.name: language_code
params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, the short description will be applied to all users for whose language there is no dedicated short description.

sections.name: getMyShortDescription
sections.description: Use this method to get the current bot short description for the given user language. Returns BotShortDescription on success.

params.name: language_code
params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code or an empty string

sections.name: setChatMenuButton
sections.description: Use this method to change the bot's menu button in a private chat, or the default menu button. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target private chat. If not specified, default bot's menu button will be changed

params.name: menu_button
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for the bot's new menu button. Defaults to MenuButtonDefault

sections.name: getChatMenuButton
sections.description: Use this method to get the current value of the bot's menu button in a private chat, or the default menu button. Returns MenuButton on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target private chat. If not specified, default bot's menu button will be returned

sections.name: setMyDefaultAdministratorRights
sections.description: Use this method to change the default administrator rights requested by the bot when it's added as an administrator to groups or channels. These rights will be suggested to users, but they are free to modify the list before adding the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: rights
params.description: A JSON-serialized object describing new default administrator rights. If not specified, the default administrator rights will be cleared.

params.name: for_channels
params.description: Pass True to change the default administrator rights of the bot in channels. Otherwise, the default administrator rights of the bot for groups and supergroups will be changed.

sections.name: getMyDefaultAdministratorRights
sections.description: Use this method to get the current default administrator rights of the bot. Returns ChatAdministratorRights on success.

params.name: for_channels
params.description: Pass True to get default administrator rights of the bot in channels. Otherwise, default administrator rights of the bot for groups and supergroups will be returned.

sections.name: Inline mode methods
sections.description: Methods and objects used in the inline mode are described in the Inline mode section.

documentation.name: Updating messages
documentation.description:
The following methods allow you to change an existing message in the message history instead of sending a new one with a result of an action. This is most useful for messages with inline keyboards using callback queries, but can also help reduce clutter in conversations with regular chat bots.
Please note, that it is currently only possible to edit messages without reply_markup or with inline keyboards.

sections.name: editMessageText
sections.description: Use this method to edit text and game messages. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

params.name: inline_message_id
params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

params.name: text
params.description: New text of the message, 1-4096 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: entities
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: link_preview_options
params.description: Link preview generation options for the message

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard.

sections.name: editMessageCaption
sections.description: Use this method to edit captions of messages. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

params.name: inline_message_id
params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

params.name: caption
params.description: New caption of the message, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: caption_entities
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard.

sections.name: editMessageMedia
sections.description: Use this method to edit animation, audio, document, photo, or video messages. If a message is part of a message album, then it can be edited only to an audio for audio albums, only to a document for document albums and to a photo or a video otherwise. When an inline message is edited, a new file can't be uploaded; use a previously uploaded file via its file_id or specify a URL. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

params.name: inline_message_id
params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

params.name: media
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new media content of the message

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new inline keyboard.

sections.name: editMessageLiveLocation
sections.description: Use this method to edit live location messages. A location can be edited until its live_period expires or editing is explicitly disabled by a call to stopMessageLiveLocation. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

params.name: inline_message_id
params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

params.name: latitude
params.description: Latitude of new location

params.name: longitude
params.description: Longitude of new location

params.name: horizontal_accuracy
params.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

params.name: heading
params.description: Direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

params.name: proximity_alert_radius
params.description: The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new inline keyboard.

sections.name: stopMessageLiveLocation
sections.description: Use this method to stop updating a live location message before live_period expires. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message with live location to stop

params.name: inline_message_id
params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new inline keyboard.

sections.name: editMessageReplyMarkup
sections.description: Use this method to edit only the reply markup of messages. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

params.name: inline_message_id
params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard.

sections.name: stopPoll
sections.description: Use this method to stop a poll which was sent by the bot. On success, the stopped Poll is returned.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Identifier of the original message with the poll

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new message inline keyboard.

sections.name: deleteMessage
sections.description: Use this method to delete a message, including service messages, with the following limitations:- A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.- Service messages about a supergroup, channel, or forum topic creation can't be deleted.- A dice message in a private chat can only be deleted if it was sent more than 24 hours ago.- Bots can delete outgoing messages in private chats, groups, and supergroups.- Bots can delete incoming messages in private chats.- Bots granted can_post_messages permissions can delete outgoing messages in channels.- If the bot is an administrator of a group, it can delete any message there.- If the bot has can_delete_messages permission in a supergroup or a channel, it can delete any message there.Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_id
params.description: Identifier of the message to delete

sections.name: deleteMessages
sections.description: Use this method to delete multiple messages simultaneously. If some of the specified messages can't be found, they are skipped. Returns True on success.

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_ids
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-100 identifiers of messages to delete. See deleteMessage for limitations on which messages can be deleted

documentation.name: Stickers
documentation.description: The following methods and objects allow your bot to handle stickers and sticker sets.

sections.name: Sticker
sections.description: This object represents a sticker.

params.name: file_id
params.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

params.name: file_unique_id
params.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the sticker, currently one of “regular”, “mask”, “custom_emoji”. The type of the sticker is independent from its format, which is determined by the fields is_animated and is_video.

params.name: width
params.description: Sticker width

params.name: height
params.description: Sticker height

params.name: is_animated
params.description: True, if the sticker is animated

params.name: is_video
params.description: True, if the sticker is a video sticker

params.name: thumbnail
params.description: Sticker thumbnail in the .WEBP or .JPG format

params.name: emoji
params.description: Emoji associated with the sticker

params.name: set_name
params.description: Name of the sticker set to which the sticker belongs

params.name: premium_animation
params.description: For premium regular stickers, premium animation for the sticker

params.name: mask_position
params.description: For mask stickers, the position where the mask should be placed

params.name: custom_emoji_id
params.description: For custom emoji stickers, unique identifier of the custom emoji

params.name: needs_repainting
params.description: True, if the sticker must be repainted to a text color in messages, the color of the Telegram Premium badge in emoji status, white color on chat photos, or another appropriate color in other places

params.name: file_size
params.description: File size in bytes

sections.name: StickerSet
sections.description: This object represents a sticker set.

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: title
params.description: Sticker set title

params.name: sticker_type
params.description: Type of stickers in the set, currently one of “regular”, “mask”, “custom_emoji”

params.name: stickers
params.description: List of all set stickers

params.name: thumbnail
params.description: Sticker set thumbnail in the .WEBP, .TGS, or .WEBM format

sections.name: MaskPosition
sections.description: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

params.name: point
params.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.

params.name: x_shift
params.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

params.name: y_shift
params.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

params.name: scale
params.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

sections.name: InputSticker
sections.description: This object describes a sticker to be added to a sticker set.

params.name: sticker
params.description: The added sticker. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, upload a new one using multipart/form-data, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. Animated and video stickers can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. More information on Sending Files »

params.name: format
params.description: Format of the added sticker, must be one of “static” for a .WEBP or .PNG image, “animated” for a .TGS animation, “video” for a WEBM video

params.name: emoji_list
params.description: List of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

params.name: mask_position
params.description: Position where the mask should be placed on faces. For “mask” stickers only.

params.name: keywords
params.description: List of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters. For “regular” and “custom_emoji” stickers only.

sections.name: sendSticker
sections.description: Use this method to send static .WEBP, animated .TGS, or video .WEBM stickers. On success, the sent Message is returned.

params.name: business_connection_id
params.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent

params.name: chat_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

params.name: message_thread_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

params.name: sticker
params.description: Sticker to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a .WEBP sticker from the Internet, or upload a new .WEBP, .TGS, or .WEBM sticker using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files ». Video and animated stickers can't be sent via an HTTP URL.

params.name: emoji
params.description: Emoji associated with the sticker; only for just uploaded stickers

params.name: disable_notification
params.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

params.name: protect_content
params.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

params.name: reply_parameters
params.description: Description of the message to reply to

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a business account.

sections.name: getStickerSet
sections.description: Use this method to get a sticker set. On success, a StickerSet object is returned.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the sticker set

sections.name: getCustomEmojiStickers
sections.description: Use this method to get information about custom emoji stickers by their identifiers. Returns an Array of Sticker objects.

params.name: custom_emoji_ids
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of custom emoji identifiers. At most 200 custom emoji identifiers can be specified.

sections.name: uploadStickerFile
sections.description: Use this method to upload a file with a sticker for later use in the createNewStickerSet, addStickerToSet, or replaceStickerInSet methods (the file can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded File on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of sticker file owner

params.name: sticker
params.description: A file with the sticker in .WEBP, .PNG, .TGS, or .WEBM format. See https://core.telegram.org/stickers for technical requirements. More information on Sending Files »

params.name: sticker_format
params.description: Format of the sticker, must be one of “static”, “animated”, “video”

sections.name: createNewStickerSet
sections.description: Use this method to create a new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to edit the sticker set thus created. Returns True on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of created sticker set owner

params.name: name
params.description: Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only English letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in "_by_<bot_username>". <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.

params.name: title
params.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

params.name: stickers
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-50 initial stickers to be added to the sticker set

params.name: sticker_type
params.description: Type of stickers in the set, pass “regular”, “mask”, or “custom_emoji”. By default, a regular sticker set is created.

params.name: needs_repainting
params.description: Pass True if stickers in the sticker set must be repainted to the color of text when used in messages, the accent color if used as emoji status, white on chat photos, or another appropriate color based on context; for custom emoji sticker sets only

sections.name: addStickerToSet
sections.description: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot. Emoji sticker sets can have up to 200 stickers. Other sticker sets can have up to 120 stickers. Returns True on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of sticker set owner

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: sticker
params.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set isn't changed.

sections.name: setStickerPositionInSet
sections.description: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

params.name: position
params.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based

sections.name: deleteStickerFromSet
sections.description: Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

sections.name: replaceStickerInSet
sections.description: Use this method to replace an existing sticker in a sticker set with a new one. The method is equivalent to calling deleteStickerFromSet, then addStickerToSet, then setStickerPositionInSet. Returns True on success.

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: old_sticker
params.description: File identifier of the replaced sticker

params.name: sticker
params.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set remains unchanged.

sections.name: setStickerEmojiList
sections.description: Use this method to change the list of emoji assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

params.name: emoji_list
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

sections.name: setStickerKeywords
sections.description: Use this method to change search keywords assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

params.name: keywords
params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters

sections.name: setStickerMaskPosition
sections.description: Use this method to change the mask position of a mask sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: sticker
params.description: File identifier of the sticker

params.name: mask_position
params.description: A JSON-serialized object with the position where the mask should be placed on faces. Omit the parameter to remove the mask position.

sections.name: setStickerSetTitle
sections.description: Use this method to set the title of a created sticker set. Returns True on success.

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: title
params.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

sections.name: setStickerSetThumbnail
sections.description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a regular or mask sticker set. The format of the thumbnail file must match the format of the stickers in the set. Returns True on success.

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: user_id
params.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

params.name: thumbnail
params.description: A .WEBP or .PNG image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have a width and height of exactly 100px, or a .TGS animation with a thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size (see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animated-sticker-requirements for animated sticker technical requirements), or a WEBM video with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-sticker-requirements for video sticker technical requirements. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files ». Animated and video sticker set thumbnails can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. If omitted, then the thumbnail is dropped and the first sticker is used as the thumbnail.

params.name: format
params.description: Format of the thumbnail, must be one of “static” for a .WEBP or .PNG image, “animated” for a .TGS animation, or “video” for a WEBM video

sections.name: setCustomEmojiStickerSetThumbnail
sections.description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a custom emoji sticker set. Returns True on success.

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

params.name: custom_emoji_id
params.description: Custom emoji identifier of a sticker from the sticker set; pass an empty string to drop the thumbnail and use the first sticker as the thumbnail.

sections.name: deleteStickerSet
sections.description: Use this method to delete a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.name: name
params.description: Sticker set name

documentation.name: Inline mode
documentation.description:
The following methods and objects allow your bot to work in inline mode.Please see our Introduction to Inline bots for more details.
To enable this option, send the /setinline command to @BotFather and provide the placeholder text that the user will see in the input field after typing your bot's name.

sections.name: InlineQuery
sections.description: This object represents an incoming inline query. When the user sends an empty query, your bot could return some default or trending results.

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this query

params.name: from
params.description: Sender

params.name: query
params.description: Text of the query (up to 256 characters)

params.name: offset
params.description: Offset of the results to be returned, can be controlled by the bot

params.name: chat_type
params.description: Type of the chat from which the inline query was sent. Can be either “sender” for a private chat with the inline query sender, “private”, “group”, “supergroup”, or “channel”. The chat type should be always known for requests sent from official clients and most third-party clients, unless the request was sent from a secret chat

params.name: location
params.description: Sender location, only for bots that request user location

sections.name: answerInlineQuery
sections.description: Use this method to send answers to an inline query. On success, True is returned.No more than 50 results per query are allowed.

params.name: inline_query_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the answered query

params.name: results
params.description: A JSON-serialized array of results for the inline query

params.name: cache_time
params.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

params.name: is_personal
params.description: Pass True if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query.

params.name: next_offset
params.description: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.

params.name: button
params.description: A JSON-serialized object describing a button to be shown above inline query results

sections.name: InlineQueryResultsButton
sections.description: This object represents a button to be shown above inline query results. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

params.name: text
params.description: Label text on the button

params.name: web_app
params.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to switch back to the inline mode using the method switchInlineQuery inside the Web App.

params.name: start_parameter
params.description: Deep-linking parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when a user presses the button. 1-64 characters, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed.Example: An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly. To do this, it displays a 'Connect your YouTube account' button above the results, or even before showing any. The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an OAuth link. Once done, the bot can offer a switch_inline button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.

sections.name: InlineQueryResult
sections.description:
This object represents one result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support results of the following 20 types:
 - InlineQueryResultCachedAudio
 - InlineQueryResultCachedDocument
 - InlineQueryResultCachedGif
 - InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif
 - InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto
 - InlineQueryResultCachedSticker
 - InlineQueryResultCachedVideo
 - InlineQueryResultCachedVoice
 - InlineQueryResultArticle
 - InlineQueryResultAudio
 - InlineQueryResultContact
 - InlineQueryResultGame
 - InlineQueryResultDocument
 - InlineQueryResultGif
 - InlineQueryResultLocation
 - InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif
 - InlineQueryResultPhoto
 - InlineQueryResultVenue
 - InlineQueryResultVideo
 - InlineQueryResultVoice
Note: All URLs passed in inline query results will be available to end users and therefore must be assumed to be public.

sections.name: InlineQueryResultArticle
sections.description: Represents a link to an article or web page.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be article

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

params.name: title
params.description: Title of the result

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: url
params.description: URL of the result

params.name: hide_url
params.description: Pass True if you don't want the URL to be shown in the message

params.name: description
params.description: Short description of the result

params.name: thumbnail_url
params.description: Url of the thumbnail for the result

params.name: thumbnail_width
params.description: Thumbnail width

params.name: thumbnail_height
params.description: Thumbnail height

sections.name: InlineQueryResultPhoto
sections.description: Represents a link to a photo. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the photo.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be photo

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

params.name: photo_url
params.description: A valid URL of the photo. Photo must be in JPEG format. Photo size must not exceed 5MB

params.name: thumbnail_url
params.description: URL of the thumbnail for the photo

params.name: photo_width
params.description: Width of the photo

params.name: photo_height
params.description: Height of the photo

params.name: title
params.description: Title for the result

params.name: description
params.description: Short description of the result

params.name: caption
params.description: Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: caption_entities
params.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the photo

sections.name: InlineQueryResultGif
sections.description: Represents a link to an animated GIF file. By default, this animated GIF file will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be gif

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

params.name: gif_url
params.description: A valid URL for the GIF file. File size must not exceed 1MB

params.name: gif_width
params.description: Width of the GIF

params.name: gif_height
params.description: Height of the GIF

params.name: gif_duration
params.description: Duration of the GIF in seconds

params.name: thumbnail_url
params.description: URL of the static (JPEG or GIF) or animated (MPEG4) thumbnail for the result

params.name: thumbnail_mime_type
params.description: MIME type of the thumbnail, must be one of “image/jpeg”, “image/gif”, or “video/mp4”. Defaults to “image/jpeg”

params.name: title
params.description: Title for the result

params.name: caption
params.description: Caption of the GIF file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: caption_entities
params.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the GIF animation

sections.name: InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif
sections.description: Represents a link to a video animation (H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound). By default, this animated MPEG-4 file will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be mpeg4_gif

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

params.name: mpeg4_url
params.description: A valid URL for the MPEG4 file. File size must not exceed 1MB

params.name: mpeg4_width
params.description: Video width

params.name: mpeg4_height
params.description: Video height

params.name: mpeg4_duration
params.description: Video duration in seconds

params.name: thumbnail_url
params.description: URL of the static (JPEG or GIF) or animated (MPEG4) thumbnail for the result

params.name: thumbnail_mime_type
params.description: MIME type of the thumbnail, must be one of “image/jpeg”, “image/gif”, or “video/mp4”. Defaults to “image/jpeg”

params.name: title
params.description: Title for the result

params.name: caption
params.description: Caption of the MPEG-4 file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: caption_entities
params.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the video animation

sections.name: InlineQueryResultVideo
sections.description:
Represents a link to a page containing an embedded video player or a video file. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

If an InlineQueryResultVideo message contains an embedded video (e.g., YouTube), you must replace its content using input_message_content.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be video

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

params.name: video_url
params.description: A valid URL for the embedded video player or video file

params.name: mime_type
params.description: MIME type of the content of the video URL, “text/html” or “video/mp4”

params.name: thumbnail_url
params.description: URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the video

params.name: title
params.description: Title for the result

params.name: caption
params.description: Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: caption_entities
params.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: video_width
params.description: Video width

params.name: video_height
params.description: Video height

params.name: video_duration
params.description: Video duration in seconds

params.name: description
params.description: Short description of the result

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the video. This field is required if InlineQueryResultVideo is used to send an HTML-page as a result (e.g., a YouTube video).

sections.name: InlineQueryResultAudio
sections.description: Represents a link to an MP3 audio file. By default, this audio file will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the audio.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be audio

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

params.name: audio_url
params.description: A valid URL for the audio file

params.name: title
params.description: Title

params.name: caption
params.description: Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: caption_entities
params.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: performer
params.description: Performer

params.name: audio_duration
params.description: Audio duration in seconds

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the audio

sections.name: InlineQueryResultVoice
sections.description: Represents a link to a voice recording in an .OGG container encoded with OPUS. By default, this voice recording will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the the voice message.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be voice

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

params.name: voice_url
params.description: A valid URL for the voice recording

params.name: title
params.description: Recording title

params.name: caption
params.description: Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: caption_entities
params.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: voice_duration
params.description: Recording duration in seconds

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the voice recording

sections.name: InlineQueryResultDocument
sections.description: Represents a link to a file. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the file. Currently, only .PDF and .ZIP files can be sent using this method.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be document

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

params.name: title
params.description: Title for the result

params.name: caption
params.description: Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: caption_entities
params.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: document_url
params.description: A valid URL for the file

params.name: mime_type
params.description: MIME type of the content of the file, either “application/pdf” or “application/zip”

params.name: description
params.description: Short description of the result

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the file

params.name: thumbnail_url
params.description: URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the file

params.name: thumbnail_width
params.description: Thumbnail width

params.name: thumbnail_height
params.description: Thumbnail height

sections.name: InlineQueryResultLocation
sections.description: Represents a location on a map. By default, the location will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the location.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be location

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

params.name: latitude
params.description: Location latitude in degrees

params.name: longitude
params.description: Location longitude in degrees

params.name: title
params.description: Location title

params.name: horizontal_accuracy
params.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

params.name: live_period
params.description: Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.

params.name: heading
params.description: For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

params.name: proximity_alert_radius
params.description: For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the location

params.name: thumbnail_url
params.description: Url of the thumbnail for the result

params.name: thumbnail_width
params.description: Thumbnail width

params.name: thumbnail_height
params.description: Thumbnail height

sections.name: InlineQueryResultVenue
sections.description: Represents a venue. By default, the venue will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the venue.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be venue

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

params.name: latitude
params.description: Latitude of the venue location in degrees

params.name: longitude
params.description: Longitude of the venue location in degrees

params.name: title
params.description: Title of the venue

params.name: address
params.description: Address of the venue

params.name: foursquare_id
params.description: Foursquare identifier of the venue if known

params.name: foursquare_type
params.description: Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

params.name: google_place_id
params.description: Google Places identifier of the venue

params.name: google_place_type
params.description: Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message

params.name: input_message_content
params.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the venue

params.name: thumbnail_url
params.description: Url of the thumbnail for the result

params.name: thumbnail_width
params.description: Thumbnail width

params.name: thumbnail_height
params.description: Thumbnail height

sections.name: InlineQueryResultContact
sections.description: Represents a contact with a phone number. By default, this contact will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the contact.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the result, must be contact

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

sections.name: InputMessageContent
sections.description:
This object represents the content of a message to be sent as a result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support the following 5 types:
 - InputTextMessageContent
 - InputLocationMessageContent
 - InputVenueMessageContent
 - InputContactMessageContent
 - InputInvoiceMessageContent

sections.name: InputTextMessageContent
sections.description: Represents the content of a text message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

params.name: message_text
params.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters

params.name: parse_mode
params.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See formatting options for more details.

params.name: entities
params.description: List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

params.name: link_preview_options
params.description: Link preview generation options for the message

sections.name: InputLocationMessageContent
sections.description: Represents the content of a location message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

params.name: latitude
params.description: Latitude of the location in degrees

params.name: longitude
params.description: Longitude of the location in degrees

params.name: horizontal_accuracy
params.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

params.name: live_period
params.description: Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.

params.name: heading
params.description: For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

params.name: proximity_alert_radius
params.description: For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

sections.name: InputVenueMessageContent
sections.description: Represents the content of a venue message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

params.name: latitude
params.description: Latitude of the venue in degrees

params.name: longitude
params.description: Longitude of the venue in degrees

params.name: title
params.description: Name of the venue

params.name: address
params.description: Address of the venue

params.name: foursquare_id
params.description: Foursquare identifier of the venue, if known

params.name: foursquare_type
params.description: Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

params.name: google_place_id
params.description: Google Places identifier of the venue

params.name: google_place_type
params.description: Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

sections.name: InputContactMessageContent
sections.description: Represents the content of a contact message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

params.name: phone_number
params.description: Contact's phone number

params.name: first_name
params.description: Contact's first name

params.name: last_name
params.description: Contact's last name

params.name: vcard

sections.name: InputInvoiceMessageContent
sections.description: Represents the content of an invoice message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

params.name: title
params.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

params.name: description
params.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

params.name: payload
params.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

params.name: provider_token
params.description: Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather

params.name: currency
params.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies

params.name: prices
params.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)

params.name: max_tip_amount
params.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0

params.name: suggested_tip_amounts
params.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tip in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

params.name: provider_data
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of the required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

params.name: photo_url
params.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.

params.name: photo_size
params.description: Photo size in bytes

params.name: photo_width
params.description: Photo width

params.name: photo_height
params.description: Photo height

params.name: need_name
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order

params.name: need_phone_number
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order

params.name: need_email
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order

params.name: need_shipping_address
params.description: Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order

params.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
params.description: Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to provider

params.name: send_email_to_provider
params.description: Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to provider

params.name: is_flexible
params.description: Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method

documentation.description: Your bot can accept payments from Telegram users. Please see the introduction to payments for more details on the process and how to set up payments for your bot.

sections.description: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent Message is returned.

params.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies

params.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)

params.name: max_tip_amount
params.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0

params.name: suggested_tip_amounts
params.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

params.name: start_parameter
params.description: Unique deep-linking parameter. If left empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice. If non-empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter

params.name: provider_data
params.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

params.name: photo_url
params.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

params.name: photo_size
params.description: Photo size in bytes

params.name: photo_width
params.description: Photo width

params.name: photo_height

params.name: disable_notification
params.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

params.name: protect_content
params.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

params.name: reply_parameters
params.description: Description of the message to reply to

params.name: reply_markup
params.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

sections.name: answerShippingQuery
sections.description: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible was specified, the Bot API will send an Update with a shipping_query field to the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries. On success, True is returned.

params.name: shipping_query_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

params.name: ok
params.description: Pass True if delivery to the specified address is possible and False if there are any problems (for example, if delivery to the specified address is not possible)

params.name: shipping_options
params.description: Required if ok is True. A JSON-serialized array of available shipping options.

params.name: error_message
params.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable'). Telegram will display this message to the user.

sections.name: answerPreCheckoutQuery
sections.description: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Bot API sends the final confirmation in the form of an Update with the field pre_checkout_query. Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries. On success, True is returned. Note: The Bot API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

params.name: pre_checkout_query_id
params.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

params.name: ok
params.description: Specify True if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order. Use False if there are any problems.

params.name: error_message
params.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).
